choices.text: How many infinite sequences a_1, a_2, ... consisting of {{1, ... ,n}} satisfy the following conditions - The n-th and subsequent elements are all equal. That is, if n \leq i,j, a_i = a_j. - For every integer i, the a_i elements immediately following the i-th element are all equal. That is, if i < j < k\leq i+a_i, a_j = a_k. Find the count modulo 10^9+7. -----Constraints----- - 1 \leq n \leq 10^6
